Item.SEODescription: The SharePoint Framework provides a modern developer experience for extending SharePoint.
Develop SharePoint client-side web parts to provide a better customized experience for SharePoint.
Set up and configure your development environment to build SharePoint client-side web parts
Set up a SharePoint developer tenant so that you can test and debug your SharePoint client-side web parts

Item.text: Build a hello world web part
Item.SEODescription: Build a hello world SharePoint client-side web part.
Connect your SharePoint client-side web part to SharePoint by using page context.

Item.text: Serve your web part in a SharePoint page
Item.SEODescription: Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part to a classic SharePoint page.

Item.text: Add jQueryUI According to your web part
Item.SEODescription: Add the jQueryUI Accordian to your SharePoint client-side web part project.

Item.text: Deploy your web part to SharePoint
Item.SEODescription: Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part assets to a CDN instead of using a local host.

Item.text: Use Office UI Fabric React components
Item.SEODescription: Build a SharePoint client-side web part that uses the DocumentCard Office UI Fabric component.
Design your SharePoint client-side web parts to use Office UI Fabric React components, be responsive, and handle publish and edit modes.
Set up properties for your SharePoint client-side web part and manage them through the property pane.

Item.text: Use Visual Studio to develop web parts
Item.SEODescription: Configure Visual Studio to open your SharePoint client-side web part project so that you can work with the project in Visual Studio.
Add an external JavaScript library to your SharePoint client-side web part such as small libaries, non-AMD modules, and localized resources.
